column4: guys, i have .ko file that i need to use in insmod to get my wireless adpter working
how i could make ubuntu do it in start?
It works already?
Put the insmod command with full path to the kernel object in /etc/rc.local
Whatever is in this file should get execuated as root
what patch i sould put it for example :D
huh?
how i would find path to some file?
You should already know where the file exists on your filesystem
well sould i use like uggis/filename.ko for example?
or do i need to use like /home/uggis/drivername.ko
In /etc/rc.local, just make a new line before exit 0 with insmod /path/to/your/module.ko
Obviously, you will need to make that path whatever it is on your system
i get what you are saying, i just dont know ubuntus file system realy well..
Ok, what is the exact insmod command you have to run every time you boot?
i do cd desktop -> cd folder -> insmod drivername.ko
Does this show the file?  ls $HOME/Desktop/folder
ls /home/uggis/desktop/folder shows it
Yes, all you have to run is insmod /home/uggis/desktop/folder/drivername.ko
thank you so much :)
i tested it and works perfectly :)
Great! :D
